Texts.Chs: 奇异之事的进一步细节...
Texts.Eng: Further details on the strange happenings...

Texts.Chs: 麦克瑞迪最近表现得很奇怪。我没法确定，但是自从那...玩意...落到他的手术刀下之后，他就变了。这令人不安。我想这一切可能在他的眼睛里。就好像他看到了你一样，以他不该有的方式了解了你。他甚至对我生活中他不在场的事情发表评论。
Texts.Eng: MacReady has been acting strange lately. I can't place my finger on it, but ever since that...thing...fell under his operating knife he's changed. It's unsettling. I think it may be in his eyes. It's almost as if he sees you and...knows you in ways he shouldn't. He even made comments on events in my life he wasn't present for.

Texts.Chs: 麦克瑞迪今天早上和我们一起吃早餐，尽管我们都有些不安。他的行为发生了显著的变化，特别是在社交方面。当它要求停止异常行为时，他野蛮地扑向道克斯并试图咬他。我们不得不制止他并给0他注射镇静剂。
Texts.Eng: MacReady joined us for breakfast this morning, though all of us were more than a bit unsettled. There were noticable changes in his behavior, especially in regards to social communication. When asked to stop behaving strangely, he savagely lunged at Doakes and attempted to bite him. We had to restrain him to inject him with a sedative.

Texts.Chs: 我们一致同意，我应该调查在冰里发现那玩意的地方之外。我们需要确定除了附近的悬崖之外，是否还有其他奇怪的东西。我需要^orange;某种抓钩^white;才能取得真正的进展。我会让道克斯给我做一个。
Texts.Eng: We all agreed that I should investigate beyond where we found the thing in the ice. We need to determine if there is anything more to this strangeness beyond the nearby cliffs. I'll need a ^orange;grappling hook of some sort^white; to make any real progress. I'll have Doakes whip one up for me.

Texts.Chs: 今天早上我们发现了一只狗。它已经被吊起来活体解剖了。它的器官在它旁边整整齐齐地堆放在地板上，堆叠得像我们在冰里发现的那种血肉变体。我怀疑麦克里迪，但没有人看到他在三天内离开过实验室。
Texts.Eng: We found one of the dogs this morning. It had been strung up and vivisected. Its organs were in a neat pile beside it on the floor, stacked to resemble that malign aberration we found in the ice. I suspect MacReady, but nobody has seen him leave his lab in three days.

Texts.Chs: 我们已经把麦克瑞迪限制在实验室里了。他完全失控了。我们宁愿冒险用那玩意把他锁在实验室里，也不愿让他攻击我们。这样对于每个人来说都是安全的，并且允许我们在这个不寻常的时期采取有限的控制措施。
Texts.Eng: We've confined MacReady to the labs. He's totally lost it. We'd rather risk locking him in the lab with that...thing...than have him trying to attack us. It's safer for everyone this way, and allows us a limited measure of control during this unusual period.
